decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful Eldrazi creatures, backed up by disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying aggressive pressure. This deck utilizes a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and close out matches quickly before the opponent can recover. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the powerful Eldrazi cards and ensure consistency in casting them early in the game.

This deck is focused on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to close out the game. The deck also utilizes card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also having access to powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. The mana base is optimized to support the control strategy, with a mix of basic lands and fetchlands, along with key utility lands like Karakas.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to abuse the graveyard mechanics to quickly fill it with dredge cards such as Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. By discarding cards like Phantasmagorian and Street Wraith, the deck can trigger the abilities of cards like Ichorid, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam to generate a swarm of creatures on the battlefield. With cards like Dread Return and Cabal Therapy, the deck is able to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Flayer of the Hatebound and win the game by overwhelming the opponent with an aggressive graveyard-based strategy.

The main theme of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and control over the game. This is achieved by using a combination of disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Kolaghan's Command, along with versatile creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board state through removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, while also being able to adapt to various threats with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outplay the opponent to secure victory.

The key of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to play aggressively and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to get threats out quickly, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Dismember help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of storm count by casting multiple cheap spells in order to cast a powerful card like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to finish off the opponent. With a mix of cantrips, rituals, and fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to create a storm chain that culminates in a lethal storm spell. The inclusion of disruption like Cabal Therapy and Duress helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down opponents while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. It also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Palace Jailer and Mother of Runes, while utilizing equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance their creatures. The mana base includes lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt opponents' mana bases with cards such as Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Simian Spirit Guide and Fiery Confluence to apply pressure. With the ability to quickly ramp into powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Chandra, Pyromaster, as well as control the board with Ensnaring Bridge, this deck aims to lock down the game early and dominate the field with its aggressive strategy.

This Legacy deck is focused on cheating powerful creatures into play as quickly as possible using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, while also having protection from counterspells with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to win the game in just a few turns by using these combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent before they can react effectively.

The main concept of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with tax effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp. The deck also aims to take control of the board with cards like Palace Jailer and Mother of Runes, while protecting its own threats with cards like Mother of Runes and Phyrexian Revoker. The equipment package of Sword of Fire and Ice, Batterskull, and Umezawa's Jitte provides additional versatility and power to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, and then use that mana to play multiple Elves and chain together cards like Glimpse of Nature to draw more cards. The deck also utilizes combo pieces like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and generate more mana, ultimately leading to a win condition with cards like Craterhoof Behemoth. Natural Order can also be used to tutor for specific combo pieces to further strengthen the board state.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play without paying their high mana costs by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes ways to protect these creatures once they are on the battlefield, with cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with these powerful creatures and their abilities, utilizing spells such as Ponder and Brainstorm to find the necessary pieces to execute the combo.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, it aims to slow down the opponent's spells and abilities. Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Batterskull and Swords provide additional threats and value. Flickerwisp and other flicker effects can be used to disrupt the opponent's permanents or protect your own creatures. The mana denial aspect is supported by cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also having some hate cards like Magus of the Moon.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain control of the game through cheap interaction spells like Stifle, Spell Snare, and Spell Pierce while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also utilizes powerful cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for threats and disruption, with Force of Will providing backup protection. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with Wasteland helping to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Ultimately, this deck aims to close out games quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing disruptive spells and countermagic. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Deathrite Shaman and Lightning Bolt to deal with a variety of threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and to take advantage of cards like Wasteland for resource denial.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. It also includes disruption in the form of Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to control the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also having access to key lands for consistency. Overall, the goal is to create a fast and efficient combo deck that can overwhelm opponents with big threats early in the game.
